Articles.Content:
As I was launching Bob for the first supersonic flight of my new campaign, I thought it would be really funny if you could hear him freaking out as he is propelled into the stratosphere

I was thinking that, having heard the sounds which Kerbals make in the videos which the developers have made, they would be really amusing making muppet inspired noises whilst in flight, with Jeb giving approving murmurs while on other occasions Bill and Bob scream, whilst mission controllers interject occasionally.
I'm not really sure about this, "AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH" the entire flight might be kinda annoying.

It could be used as a sort of alarm: when you hear jeb screaming, you know that something REALLY bad is happening.

On the other hand, hearing kerbal screaming(or laughing for jeb) would be quite annoying,especially for long trips.
if descent speed is > 700 m/s AND altitude is < 2000m then "KERBAL SCREAM"=1
Not only no but Hell No! This would take approximately 0.1 seconds to become mega annoying and send me looking for a way to turn it off permanently.

We're going for the landing, bill jeb and bob AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH! That would get annoying but it's a good and funny idea, But it'd be hard to make it where they don't get glitches and start yelling even if we're in an orbit doing absolutely nothing.

Hmmm

Surely you could mute it with a small radio panel

Also it is true that this would get annoying if it happened all the time but I think it could be coded such that it would have less things causing screaming

I'd say if it's too complex link the Kerbals behaviour to the amount of G forces they experience

Re entry flames could also trigger screaming

how about just have them scream (or laugh) only during ascents and landings and after you complete(assuming you do) these maneuvers the kerbals would just make loud breathing sounds (except for jeb) and still be capable of turning the noise off
How about only hearing scream when mousing over Kerbal Portrait?

Or, instead of screaming, some chatter. Such as - Oh good, this worked.
